snippet: Seeking to head off a fight that could threaten vulnerable Colorado Democrats, Gov. John W. Hickenlooper said he had reached a deal to keep two antifracking measures off the ballot.
abstract: Colorado Gov John W Hickenlooper says he has reached a deal to keep two antifracking measures off November ballots; agreement includes creating a task force to study the effects of drilling near homes and schools, and having the state drop 2012 lawsuit against city of Longmont, which crafted its own restrictive oil and gas rules.
lead_paragraph: Seeking to head off a fight that could threaten vulnerable Colorado Democrats, Gov. John W. Hickenlooper said he had reached a deal to keep two antifracking measures off the ballot.

headline.main: Deal Struck in Colorado Over Vote on Drilling
headline.print_headline: Deal Struck in Colorado Over Vote on Drilling
